page.title: 08Rathmell School.
page.content: Standing on the western side of the village some distance from the centre, {the school site}comprises the{main {building}with a hard{playground}and to the west, beyond the old School House, {a games field. It is a{mixed primary school}of {under 30 infants and juniors, {Voluntary Aided by the Church of {England.}The children move on to the Middle School in Settle at 10+. Most of them come from the Rathmell parish but a considerable proportion come from the neighbouring village of Wigglesworth. There are{two classes each with its own teacher (one of whom is the headteacher) helped by a part- timer and a non-teaching assistant. It is a small, compact school where a friendly, workmanlike atmosphere encourages the children to develop their personality and potential.
